"5d0224c08bae0c3384fe2585", "chapterId": "5d02254e8bae0c3384fe2586", "classId": "5d02227e8bae0c3384fe2584", "conceptTypeId": "5eaad9fdfc20563641aa3b85", "title": "আলোর প্রতিফলন (Reflection)", "description": "Reflection: Bouncing back of a light ray after hitting a surface.
Incident ray: The light ray which strikes the surface.
Reflected ray: The light ray which returns from the surface after reflection.
Normal: An imaginary line perpendicular to the surface passing from the point of contact.
Angle of incidence$$i$$: Angle between the incident ray and the normal
Angle of reflection $$r$$: Angle between the reflected ray and the normal.", "sequenceNo": 1, "createdAt": "2020-04-30T17:39:20.385Z", "updatedAt": "2020-04-30T17:55:15.203Z", "imageUrl": "https://bdix.classroom.com.bd/public/images/concepts/5eab0d486fb679443ef0894b.png", "imageUrlS3": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/new.classroom.com.bd/public/images/concepts/5eab0d486fb679443ef0894b.png", "isBookmarked": true, "conceptType": { "_id": "5eaad9fdfc20563641aa3b85", "title": "সংজ্ঞা", "sequenceNo": 1, "value": "Definition" } }, { "_id": "5eab0e1d6fb679443ef0894c", "isPublished": true, "subjectId": "5d0224c08bae0c3384fe2585", "chapterId": "5d02254e8bae0c3384fe2586", "classId": "5d02227e8bae0c3384fe2584", "conceptTypeId": "5eaadadcfc20563641aa3b86", "title": "Laws of reflection", "description": "Laws of reflection states that:
  1. The incident ray, the reflected ray and the normal at the point of incidence all lie in the same plane. 
  2. Angle of incidence is equal to the angle of reflection.

  • Blue colour of sky.
  • Red colour used as danger signal.
